main event: Two electrical engineers observed an unidentified aerial object at the Houston Light and Power station on 31st August 1949 at approximately 23:50.
interesting points: The object appeared as a ball of fire with the color of an arc weld and was about the size of an orange.
It traveled from the northeast to the southwest at a speed estimated to be over 1,000 miles per hour.
Observers estimated the object to be around 5,000 feet above the earth.
There was no trail left by the object, and it did not emit any sound or odor.
The object had a bluish-green and very brilliant luminosity.
sighted object: one unidentified aerial object (ball of fire)
